intro: Paepalanthus perplexans var. steyermarkii, commonly known as the Steyermark's puya, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its rosette growth habit and striking, spiky inflorescences. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, which are pollinated by insects. It is adapted to high-altitude environments and exhibits a unique form of vegetative reproduction through bulbils. This species is of interest to botanists due to its morphological complexity and ecological significance in its native habitat.
